mapper.select: select t.PAY_ID PayId, t.PAY_TITLE PayTitle, c.NAME CompanyName, t.PAY_MONTH PayMonth, CONVERT(varchar,t.CREATE_TIME,120) CreateTime, u.TRUENAME CreatorName from HR_SALARY_PAY t left join HR_COMPANY c on t.COMPANY_ID=c.COMPANY_ID left join T_S_USER u on t.CREATOR=u.USERID where t.PAY_TITLE like '%${value}%'

select e.PERSON_ID PersonId, e.PERSON_NAME PersonName, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as BasicWage, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as AidWageOne, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as AidWageTwo, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as AidWageThree, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as WageCount, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as Pension, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as Unemployment, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as Health, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as BuckleCount, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as TrueWage, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as Insurance, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as Fund, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as ServiceWage, CAST(0 as decimal(18,0)) as [Count] from HR_EMPLOYEE e where e.COMPANY_ID=${value}
select t.PAY_ID PayId, t.PAY_TITLE PayTitle, t.COMPANY_ID CompanyId, t.PAY_MONTH PayMonth, t.STATUS Status from HR_SALARY_PAY t where t.PAY_ID=${value}
select t.PAY_ID PayId, t.ITEM_ID ItemId, t.PERSON_ID PersonId , t.PAY_VALUE PayValue from HR_SALARY_PAY_VALUE t where t.PAY_ID=${value}
select t.PAY_ID PayId from HR_SALARY_PAY t where t.COMPANY_ID=#{CompanyId} and t.PAY_MONTH=#{PayMonth}
